001package gust.backend.model;
002
003import com.google.common.base.Joiner;
004import com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.Descriptor;
005import com.google.protobuf.Message;
006import tools.elide.core.DatapointType;
007
008import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
009import java.util.Set;
010
011
012/**
013 * Specifies an error, wherein a user has requested a data adapter or some other database object, for a model which is
014 * not usable with data storage systems (via annotations).
015 */
016public final class InvalidModelType extends PersistenceException {
017  /** Message that violated some type expectation. */
018  private final Descriptor violatingSchema;
019
020  /** Set of allowed types that the message didn't match. */
021  private final Set<DatapointType> datapointTypes;
022
023  /**
024   * Create a persistence exception from scratch.
025   *
026   * @param type Descriptor type.
027   * @param expectedTypes Available types, any one of which it can conform to.
028   */
029  InvalidModelType(@Nonnull Descriptor type, @Nonnull Set<DatapointType> expectedTypes) {
030    super(String.format("Invalid model type: '%s' is not one of the allowed types '%s'.",
031      type.getName(),
032      Joiner.on(", ").join(expectedTypes)));
033    this.violatingSchema = type;
034    this.datapointTypes = expectedTypes;
035  }
036
037  /**
038   * Factory to create a new `InvalidModelType` exception directly from a model descriptor.
039   *
040   * @param type Type of model to create this exception for.
041   * @param expectedTypes Available types, any one of which it can conform to.
042   * @return Created `InvalidModelType` exception.
043   */
044  static @Nonnull InvalidModelType from(@Nonnull Descriptor type, @Nonnull Set<DatapointType> expectedTypes) {
045    return new InvalidModelType(type, expectedTypes);
046  }
047
048  /**
049   * Factory to create a new `InvalidModelType` exception from a model instance.
050   *
051   * @param type Type of model to create this exception for.
052   * @param expectedTypes Available types, any one of which it can conform to.
053   * @return Created `InvalidModelType` exception.
054   */
055  static @Nonnull InvalidModelType from(@Nonnull Message type, @Nonnull Set<DatapointType> expectedTypes) {
056    return from(type.getDescriptorForType(), expectedTypes);
057  }
058
059  // -- Getters -- //
060
061  /** @return Message instance that violated this type constraint. */
062  public Descriptor getViolatingSchema() {
063    return violatingSchema;
064  }
065
066  /** @return Allowed types which the violating message did not match. */
067  public Set<DatapointType> getDatapointTypes() {
068    return datapointTypes;
069  }
070}
